  33. from __future__ import with_statement
  35. from permission.models import Role
  37. __all__ = ('RoleBackend',)
  40. class RoleBackend(object):
  41. """Authentication backend for role system"""
  42. supports_object_permissions = False
  43. supports_anonymous_user = False
  44. supports_inactive_user = True
  46. def authenticate(self, username, password):
  47. """This backend is only for checking permission"""
  48. return None
  50. def get_all_roles(self, user_obj):
  51. return Role.objects.filter_by_user(user_obj)
  53. def get_all_permissions(self, user_obj, obj=None):
  54. if obj is not None:
  55. # do not return any permission for obj
  56. return set()
  57. return Role.objects.get_all_permissions_of_user(user_obj)
  59. def has_role(self, user_obj, role):
  60. if user_obj.is_anonymous() or not user_obj.is_active:
  61. return False
  62. return self.get_all_roles(user_obj).filter(codename=role).exists()
  64. def has_perm(self, user_obj, perm, obj=None):
  65. if user_obj.is_anonymous() or not user_obj.is_active:
  66. return False
  67. permissions = self.get_all_permissions(user_obj, obj)
  68. permissions = set(["%s.%s" % (p.content_type.app_label, p.codename) for p in permissions])
  69. if perm in permissions:
  70. return True
  71. # do not touch this permission
  72. return False
  74. def has_module_perms(self, user_obj, app_label):
  75. if not user_obj.is_active:
  76. return False
  77. permissions = self.get_all_permissions(user_obj)
  78. permissions = set(["%s.%s" % (p.content_type.app_label, p.codename) for p in permissions])
  79. for perm in permissions:
  80. if perm[:perm.index('.')] == app_label:
  81. return True
  82. return False
  84. #
  85. # Extend User class
  86. #
  87. from django.contrib import auth
  88. from django.contrib.auth.models import User
  89. def _user_has_role(user, role, obj):
  90. anon = user.is_anonymous()
  91. active = user.is_active
  92. for backend in auth.get_backends():
  93. if anon or active or backend.supports_inactive_user:
  94. if hasattr(backend, 'has_role'):
  95. if obj is not None:
  96. if backend.has_role(user, role, obj):
  97. return True
  98. else:
  99. if backend.has_role(user, role):
  100. return True
  101. return False
  102. def _user_get_all_roles(user):
  103. anon = user.is_anonymous()
  104. active = user.is_active
  105. for backend in auth.get_backends():
  106. if anon or active or backend.supports_inactive_user:
  107. if hasattr(backend, 'get_all_roles'):
  108. return backend.get_all_roles(user)
  109. return None
  110. User.has_role = _user_has_role
  111. User.roles = property(_user_get_all_roles)
